news_header: A stampede at the Maha Kumbh festival in India resulted in at least 40 deaths and hundreds of injuries due to overcrowding and poor crowd control.
news_original_title: India: Could Maha Kumbh stampede have been prevented?
news_text: During the Maha Kumbh festival in Prayagraj, India, a stampede occurred early Wednesday, killing at least 40 people and injuring hundreds. The chaos erupted as pilgrims rushed to take a holy bath at the confluence of sacred rivers. Eyewitnesses reported that barricades were breached, leading to a crush of people. Critics pointed to inadequate crowd control measures and police presence as contributing factors. Despite advanced surveillance technology and a large police presence, crowd management failed, raising concerns about safety at large religious gatherings.
